The World Intellectual Property Organization (WIPO) International Patent Classification (IPC), established by the Strasbourg Agreement 1971, provides for a hierarchical system of language independent symbols for the classification of patents and utility models according to the different areas of technology to which they pertain.

Information.StringValue: DERIVATIVES OF N-(2-ALKYL-3-MERCAPTO-GLUTARYL) ALPHA-AMINO ACIDS AND THEIR USE AS COLLAGENASE INHIBITORS
Information.Name: Patent Title

Section.Description: A concise statement of the technical disclosure of an invention.

Information.StringValue: Novel compounds of the formula (I), processes for their preparation and their use as collagenase inhibitors are described: <CHEM> in which R1 is hydroxy; alkoxy; aryloxy; aralkyloxy; -NR6R7 where R6 and R7 are hydrogen or alkyl, or R6 and R7 together with the N-atom to which they are bonded form a 5- to 7-membered ring with an optional heteroatom; -NHCH(R8)COR9 where R8 is hydrogen; alkyl optionally substituted by hydroxy, alkoxy, -NR6R7, quanidine, CO2H, CONH2, SH, or S-alkyl; or CH2-AR where Ar is optionally substituted aryl; and R9 is hydroxy, alkoxy or -NR6R7. R2 is hydrogen or acyl. R3 is C3-6 alkyl. R4 is hydrogen; alkyl; -CH2R10 where R10 is optionally substituted phenyl or heteroaryl; or -CH(R12)O-R11 where R11 is hydrogen; alkyl; or -CH2Ph where Ph is optionally substituted phenyl; and R12 is hydrogen or alkyl. R5 is hydrogen; alkyl; or -CH(R13)COR14 where R13 is hydrogen or alkyl; and R14 is hydroxy, alkoxy or -NR6R7.
Information.Name: Patent Abstract

Other identifiers used for the patent document. 
Usually, a patent identifier is suffixed with a "kind code" (A1, A2, B1, B2, etc), which indicates the kind of patent 
document (e.g., patent application, patent grant, revision, and so on).  Patent identifiers with the same numerical 
number suffixed with different kind codes usually refer to different documents for the same invention.
